content: autopilot cowl by dominique trad this cowl was created for a simple project that is just about enjoying the yarn and doing some relaxed knitting a great project for knitting on the bus train or at a knit night it is designed for worsted weight 10ply yarn but can be done using any yarn you like materials & tools 2 skeins of 100g worsted weight 10ply yarn i used 181g of malabrigo rios which is 350m/382yd 5 5mm/us9 & 6mm/us10 circular needles i used 80cm long 1 marker to show start of new row gauge not important size sample is 20cm wide with a circumference of 160cm © dominique trad 2015 ravelry domknit autopilot cowl abbreviations k = knit p = purl yo = yarn over needle to create a stitch k2tog = knit 2 stitches together to decrease 1 instructions if you want to work to the yarn amount you have weigh your yarn before you begin using 6mm/us10 needles cast on 212sts or any multiple of 2 and join making sure not to twist place marker change to 5 5mm/us9 needles and knit garter edge as follows 1 purl 2 knit 3 purl 4 knit 5 purl 6 knit 7 purl you can weigh your yarn here to figure out how much to leave for other edge and cast off sample used 30g pattern 2st repeat 1 yo k2tog repeat to end 2 knit repeat the last 2 rounds as many times as you like for the body of the cowl sample is 25 repeats ending with the completion of a round 1 56 rounds from cast on in sample work edging 1 purl 2 knit 3 purl 4 knit 5 purl 6 knit 7 purl use a stretch bind off link on pattern page or any method that works for you blocking there is no need to block this cowl happy knitting © dominique trad 2015 ravelry domknit
